title: all: Remove support for dragonfly-386
body:
DragonFly BSD is dropping 32-bit x86 support and has turned off their dragonfly-386
builder, saying it hung anyway. From email:

"""
From: Justin Sherrill
To: me, Russ, golang-dev 
That machine is OK on disk space now.  The go builder was actually not supposed to be
started; the builder process hangs frequently and I don't know if that's a Go issue or
from other activity on that machine.

DragonFly's next release is the last for i386, and I don't think there's anyone in the
intersection of 32-bit DragonFly and running Go.  I was planning to let it go gently
into that good night.
"""

So let's drop support for dragonfly-386.
